abstracts.cdata!:
The Telecommunications Project for Niger
            includes: installation of 3,800 lines of automatic switching
            equipment with cable and subscriber distribution networks;
            improvement of long-distance services by providing trunk
            switching equipment, three very high frequency radio (VHF)
            links and one High frequency radio (HF) link, overhead line
            and carrier equipment; civil works; miscellaneous equipment,
            vehicles and tools; and 30 man-months of engineering
            consultants services; 18 man-months of financial consultants
            services; both at about US$5,400-US$5,500 per man-month and
            a total cost of US$260,000. It is hoped that Office des
            Postes et Telecommunications du Niger (OPTN) will be able to
            obtain the technical assistance it requires from other
            sources in which case the amount in the credit will be
            reduced to the extent that such assistance become available.
